author: __prettyyunknow
title: Review fr
content:
Do NOT Download Instagram â€” The Worst App Ever

Iâ€™m writing this review to warn people not to download Instagram. It used to be one of my favorite apps, but now itâ€™s honestly the worst. Instagram wrongfully suspended my account even though I did nothing wrong and always followed their community guidelines.

I had so many precious memories saved on there â€” pictures and videos of my great-grandmother who passed away, and moments that truly meant something to me. Losing access to all of that feels heartbreaking. What makes it worse is that this isnâ€™t even the first time theyâ€™ve done this to me. The last time it happened, they reviewed it and realized they made a mistake. They gave my account back, so why would they do it again when Iâ€™ve continued to follow every rule?

Instagram doesnâ€™t seem to care about its users or the memories people have stored on their accounts. Their system is unfair, and their support team is impossible to reach when you need real help. Instead of protecting honest users, they suspend accounts without explanation.

If you value your memories, your time, and your peace of mind â€” do not download Instagram. They can take away everything youâ€™ve built in an instant for no reason at all.

â€” A very disappointed and heartbroken user

author: lilirosean
title: Wrongfully disabled my account
content: On November 9th, Instagram (meta) wrongfully permanently disabled my Instagram account (as well as my spams linked to my main) for something as disgusting as CSE among other false claims using their garbage ai detection. I am an artist and followed hundred of other artists, now itâ€™s all gone. I donâ€™t even post on any of my accounts so this is extremely strange. Iâ€™ve heard recently this has happened to thousands of other people, so I know it is some type of malfunction with the ai META is using to ban accounts. Itâ€™s been 3 days since this happened and the issue has not been resolved, Iâ€™ve even sent emails to Instagram support and META, no reply. This is absolutely absurd and a very poor business choice, I doubt many people will want to use Instagram when this starts happening to everybody else. Shame on you, Instagram/meta, Iâ€™ve lost years of memories in just a few minutes.

author: CA van fans cccvv
title: Extremely Disappointed with Account Handling
content:
Iâ€™m beyond frustrated with how Instagram handles account suspensions. Without any warning or explanation, all three of my accounts â€” @minddovermatterrr, @diaryyofmiyahh, and @_miyahstyledyou â€” were suddenly disabled. I reached out professionally and respectfully through email, clearly explaining that I hadnâ€™t violated any community guidelines and that these accounts are important for both my personal and business use.

Itâ€™s been disappointing to receive no real response or help. My business depends on these pages to connect with clients, and this suspension has completely disrupted my work. Thereâ€™s no transparency, no communication, and no way to properly appeal or speak to a real person.

Instagram seriously needs to improve its support system â€” especially for small business owners who rely on their platform. Itâ€™s unacceptable to lose access to years of work and connections without warning or explanation.

author: alkary.
title: recent updates
content:
Instagram isnâ€™t tiktok and they need to stop trying to make it that way. Itâ€™s getting tiring and annoying watching them mess up the app for those of us who are genuinely just interested in connecting with people from our own circle.
Every update seems designed to push random content from strangers instead of posts from the people we actually followed. The algorithm keeps shoving Reels down our throats while burying updates from friends and family. We didnâ€™t sign up for an endless scroll of viral videos from accounts we donâ€™t know or care about.
Some of us just want a simple photo-sharing app to keep up with our actual friends, not a tiktok clone. If I wanted tiktok , Iâ€™d stay on tiktok. Instagram used to be about personal connections and now it feels like theyâ€™re sacrificing that core experience to chase trends and compete with other platforms.
Let Instagram be Instagram. Bring back the chronological feed and prioritize content from people we chose to follow. Stop forcing a completely different app experience on users who were perfectly happy with what Instagram originally was

author: Webreview
title: Terrible Customer Service
content:
My Instagram account (@jaywebbtrumpet) was recently suspended for allegedly violating Community Standards related to child sexual exploitation, abuse, or nudity. Then it was restored two days later with an apology. Now two days later it was suspended again. 
I believe this was an error. Again! 

I am a professional musician, and my account is used solely for sharing my music, performances, and professional updates. None of my content involves or promotes any form of exploitation or inappropriate material.

I have already submitted an appeal through the standard process, but I wanted to respectfully request that my case be reviewed by your integrity or account quality team as soon as possible. This account is critical to my livelihood, as I use it for fan engagement, bookings, and music promotion.

Iâ€™m happy to provide any verification or additional information needed to confirm my identity and the legitimacy of my content.

Thank you for your time and understanding,
